page.title: 06 "MEYNELL LANGLEY TREES"cont
page.content: children planted oak trees to celebrate the Jubilee. Some fine trees have been lost lately and some others are "going home".A vast elm came out immediately to the east of the Four Stall and of course many more in the park and elsewhere after Dutch elm disease struck. The beauty of Meynell Langley and indeed of England was seriously d- iminished by that disaster.The saddest moments were the loss of the larch in front of the house in Priestwood, and above all the burning down of the anient oak of Meyell Langley on Ascension Day 1984. The great Scotch pine between the house and the pond is dying back and will soon have to go. All nature is under threat at present. Dutch elm disease is only the first of a great range of tree diseases affecting both conifers and
